Title: Binding from Qur'an
Dimensions: Folio H: 4 5/16 x W: 4 5/16 in. (11 x 11 cm)
Medium: boards fastened with leather, leather satchel
Description: This binding from Walters manuscript W.853.1 is contemporary with the textblock. The upper board has a geometric design in a chevron pattern. The inside of this upper board is decorated with a star-shaped geometric design. The loose leaves of this Qur'an are sandwiched between this board and the lower board. It is common for Qur'ans from Muslim sub-Saharan Africa to assume this format.
CreditLine: Museum purchase with funds provided by the Islamic Acquisition Fund, 2000
Keywords: Koran; Qur`an; Arabic; Islamic; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Manuscript; Sub-Saharan (West) Africa
Provenance:
Present in England, before 1974 [1]. Henry Brownrigg, London, 1980s [2]; purchased by Sam Fogg Rare Books and Manuscripts, London, 1980s [3]; purchased by Walters Art Museum, 2000.

[1] According to Sam Fogg
[2] Dealer who sold at Portobello Road Market in London
[3] Sam Fogg, "Islamic Manuscripts", 2000, no. 22, pp. 56-57
Creator: Islamic
